quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler

quote: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

quote: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday’s code.
author: Dan Salomon

quote: Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but rather when there is nothing more to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
author: Cory House

quote: Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming: feedback is the treatment.
author: Kent Beck

quote: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
author: Kent Beck

quote: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: John Woods

quote: I’m not a great programmer; I’m just a good programmer with great habits.
author: Kent Beck

quote: Truth can only be found in one place: the code.
author: Robert C. Martin, Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship

quote: Give a man a program, frustrate him for a day. Teach a man to program, frustrate him for a lifetime.
author: Muhammad Waseem

quote: That’s the thing about people who think they hate computers. What they really hate is lousy programmers.
author: Larry Niven

quote: A language that doesn’t affect the way you think about programming is not worth knowing.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
author: Edward V. Berard

quote: Perl – The only language that looks the same before and after RSA encryption.
author: Keith Bostic

quote: Programming isn’t about what you know; it’s about what you can figure out.
author: Chris Pine

quote: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: Low-level programming is good for the programmer’s soul.
author: John Carmack

quote: Programmers are not to be measured by their ingenuity and their logic but by the completeness of their case analysis.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: What kind of programmer is so divorced from reality that he thinks he'll get complex software right the first time?
author: James Alan Gardner, Ascending

quote: There are 10 types of people in this world, those who understand binary and those who don't.
author: Anonymous

quote: Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
author: Ron Jeffries

quote: Any code of your own that you haven’t looked at for six or more months might as well have been written by someone else.
author: (Eagleson’s Law)

quote: There are only two kinds of languages: the ones people complain about and the ones nobody uses.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

quote: Premature optimization is the root of all evil.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: Simplicity is prerequisite for reliability.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quote: Software being 'Done' is like lawn being 'Mowed'.
author: Jim Benson

quote: There’s no test like production.
author: Anonymous

quote: One man’s constant is another man’s variable.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: One of the best programming skills you can have is knowing when to walk away for awhile.
author: Oscar Godson

quote: The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit.
author: Bryan

quote: Java: write once, run away!
author: Brucee

quote: If Java had true garbage collection, most programs would delete themselves upon execution.
author: Robert Sewell

quote: The definition of Hell is working with dates in Java, JDBC, and Oracle. Every single one of them screw it up.
author: Dick Wall CommunityOne 2007: Lunch with the Java Posse

quote: There are two ways of constructing a software design: One way is to make it so simple that there are obviously no deficiencies, and the other way is to make it so complicated that there are no obvious deficiencies. The first method is far more difficult.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

quote: If debugging is the process of removing software bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
author: Edsger Dijkstra

quote: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
author: Bill Gates

quote: When debugging, novices insert corrective code; experts remove defective code.
author: Richard Pattis

quote: Good code is its own best documentation. As you’re about to add a comment, ask yourself, ‘How can I improve the code so that this comment isn’t needed?’
author: Steve McConnell

quote: Cherish your exceptions.
author: Anonymous

quote: Copy and paste is a design error.
author: David Parnas

quote: Code is not like other how-computers-work books. It doesn’t have big color illustrations of disk drives with arrows showing how the data sweeps into the computer. Code has no drawings of trains carrying a cargo of zeros and ones. Metaphors and similes are wonderful literary devices but they do nothing but obscure the beauty of technology.
author: Charles Petzold, Code: The Hidden Language of Computer Hardware and Software

quote: When he really, really likes a girl, he creates a font and names it after her.
author: David Levithan, Every Day

quote: If, at first, you do not succeed, call it version 1.0.
author: Khayri R.R. Woulfe

quote: Code is there to explain the comments to the computer.
author: Andy Harris

quote: A long descriptive name is better than a short enigmatic name. A long descriptive name is better than a long descriptive comment.
author: Robert C. Martin, Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship

quote: Syntactic sugar causes cancer of the semicolon.
author: Alan J. Perlis, Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs

quote: Pascal for real programmers; Delphi for Nerds; C/C++ for people who always wished to do things like reinventing the wheel.
author: Rejie Roque (edited.)

quote: In the happy land of elegant code and pretty rainbows, there lives a spoil-sport monster called inefficiency.
author: Marijn Haverbeke, Eloquent JavaScript: A Modern Introduction to Programming

quote: If a machine ever gains awareness, it will be not due to our careful programming, but due to an unforeseeable anomaly.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The Gospel of Technology

quote: Programmer: A machine that turns coffee into code.
author: Unknown

quote: Computers are fast; programmers keep it slow.
author: Unknown

quote: When I wrote this code, only God and I understood what I did. Now only God knows.
author: Unknown

quote: A son asked his father (a programmer) why the sun rises in the east, and sets in the west. His response? It works, don’t touch!
author: Unknown

quote: How many programmers does it take to change a light bulb? None, that’s a hardware problem.
author: Unknown

quote: Programming can be fun, and so can cryptography; however, they should not be combined.
author: Unknown

quote: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the Universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. So far, the Universe is winning.
author: Unknown

quote: Algorithm: Word used by programmers when they don’t want to explain what they did.
author: Unknown

quote: Software and cathedrals are much the same — first we build them, then we pray.
author: Unknown

quote: There are two ways to write error-free programs; only the third works.
author: Unknown

quote: If debugging is the process of removing bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
author: Unknown

quote: Remember that there is no code faster than no code.
author: Unknown

quote: One man’s crappy software is another man’s full-time job.
author: Unknown

quote: No code has zero defects.
author: Unknown

quote: A good programmer is someone who always looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
author: Unknown

quote: Deleted code is debugged code.
author: Unknown

quote: Don’t worry if it doesn’t work right. If everything did, you’d be out of a job.
author: Unknown

quote: It’s not a bug — it’s an undocumented feature.
author: Unknown

quote: Programming made the impossible possible. You can have a null object and a constant variable.
author: Unknown

quote: C makes it easy to shoot yourself in the foot; C++ makes it harder, but when you do, it blows your whole leg off.
author: Unknown

quote: C++: An octopus made by nailing extra legs onto a dog.
author: Unknown

quote: When your hammer is C++, everything begins to look like a thumb.
author: Unknown

quote: C programmers never die. They are just cast into void.
author: Unknown

quote: One of the main causes of the fall of the Roman Empire was that lacking zero, they had no way to indicate successful termination of their C programs.
author: Unknown

quote: In C we had to code our own bugs. In C++ we can inherit them.
author: Unknown

quote: Q: How different are C and C++?A: 1. Because C — C++ = 1.
author: Unknown

quote: What’s the object-oriented way to get wealthy? Inheritance.
author: Unknown

quote: Why do Java programmers have to wear glasses? Because they don’t C#.
author: Unknown

quote: Q: What did the Java code say to the C code? A: You’ve got no class.
author: Unknown

quote: If you put a million monkeys at a million keyboards, one of them will eventually write a Java program. The rest of them will write Perl programs.
author: Unknown

quote: Some people when confronted with a problem think: ‘I know, I’ll use regular expressions.’. Now they have two problems.
author: Unknown

quote: Programmer’s partner: ‘Are you going to sit and type in front of that thing all day, or are you going out with me?’. Programmer: ‘Yes.’.
author: Unknown

quote: A SQL query goes into a bar, walks up to two tables, and asks, ‘Can I join you?’.
author: Unknown

quote: Two bytes meet. The first byte asks, ‘Are you ill?’. The second byte replies, ‘No, just feeling a bit off.’.
author: Unknown

quote: There are only two hard things in computer science: cache invalidation and naming things.
author: Phil Karlton

quote: Q: Why did the programmer quit his job? A: Because he didn't get arrays.
author: Unknown

quote: UNIX is simple. It just takes a genius to understand its simplicity.
author: Unknown

quote: UNIX is user friendly. It’s just very particular about who its friends are.
author: Unknown

quote: UNIX was not designed to stop people from doing stupid things, because that would also stop them from doing clever things.
author: Unknown

quote: A system administrator has two problems: 1. Dumb users. 2. Smart users.
author: Unknown

quote: Potential partners are like internet domain names — the ones I like are already taken.
author: Unknown

quote: Keyboard Failure. Press F1 to continue.
author: Unknown

quote: If the box says, ‘This software requires Windows XP or better,’ does that mean it’ll run on Linux?
author: Unknown

quote: .NET is called .NET so that it wouldn’t show up in a UNIX directory listing.
author: Unknown

quote: Hardware is made to last. Software is made to change. Change is the only thing that lasts. Software wins.
author: Unknown

quote: There’s no place like 127.0.0.1.
author: Unknown

quote: In a room full of top software designers, if two agree on the same thing, that’s a majority.
author: Unknown

quote: One: Demonstrations always crash. And two: The probability of them crashing goes up exponentially with the number of people watching.
author: Unknown

quote: A program is never less than 90% complete and never more than 95% complete.
author: Unknown

quote: Most of you are familiar with the virtues of a programmer. There are three, of course: laziness, impatience, and hubris.
author: Unknown

quote: I’ve finally learned what upward compatible means. It means we get to keep all our old mistakes.
author: Unknown

quote: Documentation is like sex: When it is bad, it is better than nothing. When it is good, it is really, really good.
author: Unknown

quote: Software undergoes beta testing shortly before it’s released. Beta is Latin for still doesn’t work.
author: Unknown

quote: When we had no computers, we had no programming problems either.
author: Unknown

quote: There is an easy way and a hard way. The hard part is finding the easy way.
author: Unknown

quote: When all else fails... reboot.
author: Unknown

quote: You might not think that programmers are artists, but programming is an extremely creative profession. It’s logic-based creativity.
author: John Romero

quote: The 50-50-90 rule: Anytime you have a 50-50 chance of getting something right, there’s a 90% probability you’ll get it wrong.
author: Andy Rooney

quote: In software, the most beautiful code, the most beautiful functions, and the most beautiful programs are sometimes not there at all.
author: Jon Bentley

quote: A code is like love, it has created with clear intentions at the beginning, but it can get complicated.
author: Gerry Geek

quote: Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
author: Ron Jeffries

quote: No one in the brief history of computing has ever written a piece of perfect software. It’s unlikely that you’ll be the first.
author: Andy Hunt

quote: Progress is possible only if we train ourselves to think about programs without thinking of them as pieces of executable code.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quote: The value of a prototype is in the education it gives you, not in the code itself.
author: Alan Cooper

quote: A user interface should be so simple that a beginner in an emergency can understand it within ten seconds.
author: Ted Nelson

quote: All problems in computer science can be solved by another level of indirection.
author: David Wheeler

quote: It’s harder to read code than to write it.
author: Joel Spolsky

quote: Don’t repeat yourself. Every piece of knowledge must have a single, unambiguous, authoritative representation within a system.
author: Andy Hunt & Dave Thomas

quote: There are two hard things in computer science: cache invalidation, naming things, and off-by-one errors.
author: Leon Bambrick

quote: Ethereum has taken what was a four-function calculator of a programming language in Bitcoin and turned it into a full-fledged computer.
author: Fred Ehrsam

quote: Bad programmers worry about the code. Good programmers worry about data structures and their relationships.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: Good software, like wine, takes time.
author: Joel Spolsky

quote: Software is a great combination between artistry and engineering.
author: Bill Gates

quote: The first 90 percent of the code accounts for the first 90 percent of the development time. The remaining 10 percent of the code accounts for the other 90 percent of the development time.
author: Tom Cargill

quote: Indeed one of the best ways to deflect attacks is to make it look like they’re succeeding. It’s the software equivalent of playing dead.
author: Joel Spolsky

quote: Machines take me by surprise with great frequency.
author: Alan Turing
